intro: Kochia enchylaenoides, commonly known as the red tumbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is known for its vibrant red coloration, which becomes more pronounced as it matures and begins to dry out. Kochia enchylaenoides is an annual herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and ability to produce a large amount of biomass make it both a notable weed and a valuable source of forage for wildlife.
